title: DrHodler59
author: DrHodler59
content: Hello!I wanted to ask if any of you have any ideas/thought inspirations for potential business ideas (own small store/shop) related to or involving Bitcoin?I'm aware that I could simply offer Bitcoin as a payment alternative... Of course, I would do that as well, but I'm looking for something with a bit more connection to Bitcoin.Perhaps some of you have cool and exciting ideas that we could discuss, or maybe you've visited an interesting business idea during a trip abroad (e.g., El Salvador, Venezuela, etc.) that could serve as inspiration.Thank you very much for your responses!Yours sincerely,DrHodler59

comments.author: coolcoinz
comments.body: Some ideas:Bitcoin collectibles Physical coins (like Casascius), bitcoin art, things like framed 2009 The Times article, t-shirts and other stuff related to bitcoin.Maybe a business where you print and engrave stuff, including bitcoin logos, people's addresses so that they're visible on people's personal items.I don't know what your background is. For instance if you're in car detailing, you could make wraps with bitcoin related stuff and place them on people's cars if they want to drive with their wallet QR code on a bumper and such. I've heard that reselling and refurbishing used mining equipment can pay well, but you have to know how to do it.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Start e-commerce that people can use bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies for paying for what they are ordering forIf you have enough money, you can begin an exchange serviceP2P buying and selling of bitcoin is another one that you can go forYou can make any service offer like tell the people that you are accepting bitcoin.These are the one that comes my mind right now.

comments.body: Quote from: coolcoinz on June 19, 2024, 07:42:00 PMBitcoin collectibles Physical coins (like Casascius), bitcoin art, things like framed 2009 The Times article, t-shirts and other stuff related to bitcoin.Maybe a business where you print and engrave stuff, including bitcoin logos, people's addresses so that they're visible on people's personal items.If the OP cannot utilise buying/selling via a website your suggestion of collectibles might be a good first step especially for any items that date back to 2009/2010 as they would have a lot of value.Quote from: Oshosondy on June 19, 2024, 07:46:35 PMStart e-commerce that people can use bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies for paying for what they are ordering forWithout knowing the background skills the OP possesses it will be difficult to understand what ideas he might be open to but would he really want to rely on other people to create and maintain his websites and have to pay them for their services? Maybe he will feel far more comfortable doing something else on the lines of what what was suggested by coolcoinz because it removes intermediaries but that is for the OP to expand on.

comments.author: d5000
comments.body: If your idea is a small store/shop as you wrote in the OP:I don't know where you're located, but many people do not have access to a store selling goods covering basic needs (clothing, grocery articles) with Bitcoin and for a competitive price. Most stores in my country which accept Bitcoin either only offer a limited range of mainly high-priced and imported goods (for example phones), hospitality (hotels/apartments for tourists), or they are demanding a large premium (think of the Amazon resellers).Entering this niche can be a business idea, but of course you have to research if the market with the goods you're wanting to sell is already saturated. Also research which gift cards are sold in your country via Bitrefill, because gift cards of course compete with physical goods.Alternatively you could provide gift cards yourself cooperating with businesses which are still not accessible on sites like Bitrefill and could have demand from Bitcoiners.If the goods you're selling are low-cost, I would also suggest to accept other cryptocurrencies like LTC or XMR, because they are more convenient due to their lower transaction fees.

comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: Any business can be related to bitcoin nowadays, just put it somewhere in your business that you accept bitcoin as a payment and you'd be set for life. Also, it's nice that you're asking for ideas of business that you can start with the help of bitcoin or that's something bitcoin related but you have to remember that what works the best for you might be the thing that you need to work out on because you might think that the idea right now that's recommended to you is good business that you can do but then when you're doing it, you suddenly realize that this isn't it.

comments.author: GreatArkansas
comments.body: For me, from what I experienced about lacking in the market right now is a Bitcoin payment gateway.It's a system that will serve as a bridge to business owners to consumers to accept Bitcoin as payments for their businesses.I believe there are still a few businesses that doing this and as a business, there will be a lot of requirements for selecting a good Bitcoin payment gateway.

comments.author: OcTradism
comments.body: Quote from: DrHodler59 on June 19, 2024, 07:32:24 PMI wanted to ask if any of you have any ideas/thought inspirations for potential business ideas (own small store/shop) related to or involving Bitcoin?I'm aware that I could simply offer Bitcoin as a payment alternative... Of course, I would do that as well, but I'm looking for something with a bit more connection to Bitcoin.You have to consider many things from both sides for a business operator, entrepreneur and customers.Accepting Bitcoin will bring advantage and disadvantage. As a business operator, you must consider some things like.How the customer payments in bitcoin, to your business wallet, will be stored. It relates to security of your business fund, treasury that must be secured and safe.What will you do with customer payments? Do you store it as your business investment in Bitcoin or will you have to sell it to get money for your business operation?It decides your plan to hold your bitcoin from customer payments or sell it immediately after receiving.Marketing, how do you attract customers to your business and convince them to use bitcoin as payment method?If you have to do discount for them, it can affect your business budget, net ROI.As customers, they have to think of extra on chain transaction fee if they use Bitcoin blockchain as payment method. They will have to ask whether your business take care of their on chain transaction fee.Customers will not be ready to pay extra fee.Lightning Network can be a good choice for business with not big transactions from customers.

comments.author: Marvell1
comments.body: Quote from: DrHodler59 on June 19, 2024, 07:32:24 PMI wanted to ask if any of you have any ideas/thought inspirations for potential business ideas (own small store/shop) related to or involving Bitcoin?Bitcoin was designed to be a currency so you can only use it as a payment method for your business, and you can't do anything else with it. And if you are looking for business ideas based on bitcoin, the same way children's toy designers rely on superhero movies to create models of Marvell or DC superheroes, you can also take advantage of this idea with bitcoin. It will all depend on your field and expertise as well as the demand in your area, as coolcoinz suggests: physical coins, logos, toys...For example, in my country, some fashion businesses sell clothes, hats, shoes...all with bitcoin logos or related to cryptocurrency. In addition, there are cafes with spaces and interiors designed with bitcoin logos or images, and Lego bitcoin models are displayed around the cafe...

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: I don't think there's other promising business idea except selling merchandises about Bitcoin especially you lack of capital.If you offer something not related to Bitcoin, the buyers don't care with Bitcoin and they most likely will pay with other payment method.But, if you sell things about Bitcoin, the buyers most likely Bitcoin enthusiast or interested with Bitcoin, they may likely pay with Bitcoin even though it would cost them more.

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Banks in my country a restricted from making some amount of payments to customers. Businesses and individuals have a limit they can withdraw or transfer. This limitation is affecting businesses that need to make payments both locally and internationally. I know some importers who are having problems with their international partners because of this problem. Convincing them to accept Bitcoin and providing such services can be profitable.  Having a payment service where the firm can help individuals and businesses make payments using Bitcoin will be a good one. This service can help businesses invade this restriction affecting them negatively.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Well, I think first you have to consider the business you can do very well and not just any business you feel like you should do because another person is doing it. There are lots of businesses, ranging from grocery stores, food marts, coffee shops, cyber cafes, clothing shops and other fashion accessory shops, barbing saloons, etc. You have to be decisive about the kind of business you have the skill for and the one you can do passionately. After you have decided the kind of business you want to start, rent a shop and buy your needed goods. Next is to introduce Bitcoin Payment as your second payment option.
